fields.description:
* look into trying  a sample rate of 16khz and sample bitsize of 16.
* make a methode for the buffer sizes so they reflect the audio format config.\\
following taking from stack overflow

"To see why, you must simply notice that the function in question takes a byte array as an argument and processes each value from that array individually. The byte datatype is an 8-bit value. If you want something that works with 16-bit values, you need to use a different datatype (short) or convert to that from bytes.

Once you do that, you will still get different values for 16 bits vs 8 bit because the range is different: 8 bit goes from -128 to +127 and 16 bit goes from -32768 to +32767, but they are both measuring the same thing, meaning they scaling the same real-word values to different represented values.

As for sound-levels and their relationship to time.... well it depends on your sample rate and the size of the arrays going into this function. For example, if your samplerate is 8kHz and you have 2048 samples per buffer, then your function is going to be called 8000/2048 or about 3.9 times per second, meaning your results are coming in at that rate (every 256 milliseconds)."
fields.summary: Compared performance when using differnt audio format config

fields.description:
Hi,

i built a app that analyses project files. Everything worked fine until  one of my client complained that he doesnt see his invited projects hosted on Bitbucket;

I'm using API2.0 as it's the newest and a better version of old one; but it's repositories endpoint doesnt show same info as APIv1. Is there any particular reason for that?

I dont like to mix different api versions into my app; and API1 has many deprecated methods and repositories is one of them; Is there any better solution and when it's planned to fix?

Timo,\\
cofounder of VersionEye
fields.summary: Api v2.0 doesnt show invited project via repositories endpoint;

fields.description:
We have been using git pull from our server to bitbucket over a yea, suddenly today we run into issue:

{code}
git pull origin dev
conq: repository access denied.
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
{code}

We use our crontab for pulling code from bitbucket, did you recently change anything regarded to setup, keys or something else ?
fields.summary: Problem with pull

fields.description:
+Bug reproduction steps:+

# Create a new repo (like all new repos, it will start out empty).
# Do NOT add any content to the repo,
# fork the empty repo.
# Add content to the forked repo.
# Now try to generate a pull request from the forked repo to the new (still empty) repo.
# You will see a page that says "Something went wrong"

I consider this a bug for these reasons:

# From a git standpoint this should work fine (and does on git hub or gitlab)
# This is a common situation for our work flow (where a repo admin creates and controls master repos, but all content is generated by folks other than the admin).

+Workaround:+
Add any dummy file to the new repo before the 1st fork is made: then the pull request will process normally. However, this litters the repo with an uneeded file just to avoid the bug.

More info is in bitbucket support request BBS-6783\\
I opened this issue at the suggestion of the Atlassian support.

Dave
fields.summary: Creating a PR from a fork fails if the repo you forked from is empty

fields.description:
sym-links are represented as normal files with special attributes in Mercurial.

In Bitbucket, this is not easy to spot. With the recently introduced editor it is easy to edit such a "symlink file" without knowing that this is represents a symlink.

Either prevent the editing of symlink files completely or at least display a warning that one is currently editing a symlink and not a regular file.

fields.description:
https://bitbucket.org/dapurmasak/tempe/commits/acbc1d3777d78a1d6a4c251e8695d0afed99baee

Our team is using private git from bitbucket. From the beginning, commits and image assets was generated from Mac and Linux. Some team member is using Windows, and the trouble began when they try to do commit and push.

Each time we push commit to Bitbucket with image asset created from GIMP in Windows, each image become corrupted. You can see the attachment below.

And then we tried to clone it again to try and see whether the corrupted images is carried out. Unfortunately, all our images is now corrupted.

Additional info, we are using Vagrant with VIrtualBox for devops. The OS is using Ubuntu in Windows 8 host.

Our repository folder is synced to it, that's why we can do commit from Windows.

This problem also arise when we checkout to other branch in Windows.

In my opinion, this is related to LF and CRLF line endings. Any suggestion?
fields.summary: Corrupt Images when committing from Windows

fields.description:
reading the wiki page with documention for django-piston [1], i noticed this sentence:

"NB: These "resource methods" should be decorated with the AWS Solution Division decorator, as they will not always receive an instance of itself. "

the "AWS Solution Division" in the middle was weird, have attached a screenshot of it. cloning the wiki and looking at the file Documentation.wiki, the original sentence seems to be:

"*NB*: These "resource methods" should be decorated with the @classmethod decorator, as they will not always receive an instance of itself."

i guess for some reason the "@classmethod" is being rendered as "AWS Solution Division".

there did not seem to be a similar issue on the wiki issues list, but i could have missed it (dont have the time to look really thoroughly through all of them, sorry).

[1] https://bitbucket.org/jespern/django-piston/wiki/Documentation?_escaped_fragment_=piston-documentation#!resources
fields.summary: wiki rendering @classmethod as "AWS Solution Division"

fields.description:
These sorts of incidents make me pine for the site to give me pause

# Begin writing or editing an issue or comment
# Click "Preview"
# Forget that you need to click the "Preview" (now "Edit") button, especially if the post is long, and instead hit "Cancel" at the bottom
# Lose all your work without a moment's pause.

If the user does want to "Cancel", they can simply navigate away without updating a wiki page or issue.  Most modern browsers seem to keep form state if one goes back then immediately forwards again, but the JS that "Cancel" fires irrecoverably destroys the information, mildly amusing for a VCS hosting provider.

Looking at another site, StackOverflow, there are a couple major differences that I feel make for far superior UX:

# You are warned about potentially destructive actions (going to another post, closing the window, hitting back, etc), and also:
# *There is no "cancel".* Web forms are not modal, you do not need to "abort" entering data in order to go do another task instead. [I'll let the Nielsen Norman group, a UX research firm explain it|http://www.nngroup.com/articles/reset-and-cancel-buttons/].

#* What you call "Cancel", Nielsen calls "Reset", a much more destructive thing:

bq. * The worst problem about Reset is that users click the button by mistake when they wanted to click Submit . Bang — all your work is gone!
* Having two buttons at the bottom of a form clutters up the interface and makes it harder for users to clearly see their next step. Some small amount of wasted time is spent scanning the useless button and deciding which of the two buttons is the correct one.
fields.summary: Consider renaming "Cancel" links to "Discard" for clarity (BB-10638)

fields.description:
See hpk42/pytest repository's [pull request # 98|https://bitbucket.org/hpk42/pytest/pull-request/98/document-explicitly-clearing-local/diff].

Its [overview page|https://bitbucket.org/hpk42/pytest/pull-request/98/document-explicitly-clearing-local/diff] states that it added file '/contribute.txt' and removed the file 'doc/en/contribute.txt'.

Its [commits page|https://bitbucket.org/hpk42/pytest/pull-request/98/document-explicitly-clearing-local/commits] on the other hand states that the pull request includes just [commit 9545ee0|https://bitbucket.org/hpk42/pytest/commits/9545ee037ecb9de2177a1ee0ba4e50bfa181adac] which in turn does not include any changes to any files named either '/contribute.txt' or 'doc/en/contribute.txt'.

Note also that the added '/contribute.txt' file has an invalid name, and that after merging this pull request the repository will be left in an invalid state and you will not be able to clone it or update to its head commit after pulling changes from it.

Files with 'contribute.txt' were part of something another developer (one that applied the pull request) was woking on at the moment, but should not have been detected as part of this pull request.

It is possible that something in either Mercurial or BitBucket's toolchain got confused by the changes in the pull request being on the default branch as a separate branch head instead of being on a separate named branch.

Hope this helps.

Best regards,\\
Jurko Gospodnetić
fields.summary: Pull request merging changes not included in its commits. (BB-10000)

fields.description:
One of our developers followed the steps in, I presume, https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Import+code+from+an+existing+project .

In my (=some kind of admin's) mailbox, a notification appeared:

Subject: Fwd: [Bitbucket] Your Git import job for some-repo-name has finished\\
You are receiving this email because you're an administrator of the some-team-name team.\\
The remote Git import you started for https://actualusername:actualpassword@fully.qualified.hostname/some/local/path completed successfully.\\
View repository\\
Team email forwarding can be configured from the groups administration page 	\\
Bitbucket

I see several things wrong with this:

# the password is sent to another person
# the password is sent in clear text from Australia (?) to Sweden (?), intercepted by NSA, GCHQ, FRA and others

Could you perhaps try to filter out passwords from these links that you send out?
fields.summary: Bitbucket sending out our passwords by e-mail (BB-9953)

fields.description:
In my git repository's "Create Branch" dialog, I want to create a branch with a version in it.  3.6.0, for example. But Bitbucket won't let me do this.

I can enter in "version-3.6.0", but the preview just shows "version-360".  And sure enough, the branch is created as "version-360".

Dots are perfectly legal in git branch names.  Please allow them to be added via the web.
fields.summary: Cannot create branches with dots in the name (BB-9957)

fields.description: If you are reviewing a pull request, an email is sent for every individual comment as they are made.  I would be nice to batch them up, either after some configurable "wait period" or by the comment pushing a Publish Now button (I prefer the button, so I would configure it to a long wait period to avoid it altogether).  This would allow the submitter to know to not wait for further emails from that reviewer.
fields.summary: Batch Email for comments on a pull request

fields.description: An email notification when a pull request comment is modified would allow the co-reviewers and pull request author to know that the comment they received in their inbox is outdated.
fields.summary: Send a notication when a pull request comment is updated (BB-9956)

fields.description:
It would be very nice to be able to generate public link for files in private repositories.

Like the "Raw" function, but it would generate an authenticated URL for downloading, with the option to set an expiry date.
fields.summary: Public URL on private repositories (BB-9955)

fields.description: Currently, only issue id's are linked in commit messages. Try to also link things that look like hashes in the {{#frb78f34}} format as links to commits.

fields.description:
For example, I uploaded file named "ГрафикРазработки.xlsx" to Downloads section of our repository (not in the source code).

It's name is correctly displayed in files list, and can be downloaded.

But when I download it, downloaded file has name like "!5D" instead of "ГрафикРазработки.xlsx" (as it was original).
fields.summary: Russian filenames broken in Downloads when downloading. (BB-9967)
Trailing punctuation in links is swallowed up (BB-9936)

fields.description:
I got an email invitation to 'collaborate on code on Bitbucket'. (_You've been invited to collaborate on code with xxx on Bitbucket_)\\
I accepted the invitation.\\
Then I got a '[Bitbucket] Confirm your email address' with a link that will take me to my home page with the warning 'We were unable to confirm the email address. The validation email may have expired'.

Maybe the email confirmation is not necessary when I was invited?
fields.summary: Don't ask user to confirm email when they were invited (BB-9964)

fields.description:
https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues?responsible=!\\
(_pay attention to exclamation mark after equal sign_)\\
shows *all* issues, as if not filtered at all. The applied filter is (correctly) stated as

bq. *assignee*: someone


The issue has already been addressed in BCLOUD-3367, which has been (falsely) marked as dupplicate of BCLOUD-502 ("assignee: no one" didn't work at that time).
fields.summary: Filtering issues by "Assignee is not unassigned" not working (BB-9937)

{"errorMessages":[],"errors":{"customfield_10300":"Option id 'null' is not valid","customfield_10201":"Option id 'null' is not valid"}}

But all mandatory fields are filled with data. Input excel sheet attached.

fields.description: I have for this to sound crass but it seems like even the basic stuff with these new APIs don't work properly. For example, executing the following: https://bitbucket.org/api/2.0/repositories/pypy/pypy/pullrequests/93/commits gives me a sweet list of commits - everything is good so far. However, the "links" within the commits are completely wrong. The first "self" link: "href": "https://bitbucket.org/!api/2.0/repositories/pypy/pypy/commit/9fd1c9e7f3fc08a847202a143b69dedcb2b688bd" leads me to a 404. And when I inspect it, it's not even pointing to the right repository that commit was made on!  Instead of "pypy/pypy" it should have been "mpavone/pypy". It doesn't even sound like these are tested...
fields.summary: REST API 2.0: Pull Request "Links" are Wrong (BB-9965)

Egidio

See 'git help config' and search for 'push.default' for further information.

fields.description:
Aside from the fact that the event api tells you what type of event occured there is almost no useful data on said event. For example, an event that comes back with a type of "pullrequest_comment_created" has the following in the description: "1080954". Now that is obviously not the comment. This occurs for many other things like issues, followers, etc... On the other hand, the "commit" event has the following in the description:

"total_commits": 1,\\
"commits": [\\
{\\
"hash": "c88e3c0b94bc1a02b7e25c35075cd8c342dd835c",\\
"description": "grammar fix"\\
}\\
]

very useful!
fields.summary: REST API: Events has almost no useful data (BB-9963)

fields.description:
Currently, the Find Repository search box must match the start of the repository name.  It would be very helpful to have any substring found in the name, or use wildcards at the start (I'm fine with full regex requiring .* as well).

For example, if a repo is names {{products_apollo-server}}, I should be able to search for just {{apollo}} and find it (or {{*apollo*}}).

If searching the entire bitbucket site is too heavy in this way, it would still be beneficial to at least do this type of search within the current teams.

(Our team is using repository names prefixes in lieu of repository organization, like products_, libjava_, tools_, etc.  Eventually, we hope to have folders or something like that, as requested elsewhere [BB-1086|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/2323/].
fields.summary: Find repository with substrings (BB-9687)

fields.description: Let's say I change the Component of a ticket from A to B. There's a log entry saying I changed it to B, but the original fact that it was A to begin with is permanently lost. We should be able to see this information!
fields.summary: Show original value for edited ticket data (BB-9959)

fields.description: I tried to authenticate a Twitter hook but got a red 'Invalid request' message.  Is it a temporary problem?
fields.summary: Error to authenticate a Twitter hook (BB-9972)

fields.description: It would be nice if you would highlight the current line in the source view if you specify the line in the url via {{?at=master#cl-54}}. In this case the line 54 should be highlighted.
fields.summary: Highlight the current line in the source view if it's defined in the url (BB-9929)

fields.description:
It would be nice to have the title of an commit as a popup if it gets referenced in an issue. That would allow to quickly identify commits if a ticket mentions multiple commits.

Thanks and greetings\\
Leo
fields.summary: Show the title of an commit if it gets referenced in an issue

fields.description:
Hi

We have a repository which holds lots of shell and perl scripts. We add the files to repository (from windows client) with executable permissions (using cygwin) but when we pull that repository on another machine (windows or linux), files dont have executable permission.  Can you please provide a solutions for this?

We also tried post-commit and post-receive hooks to set the permission but it didnt seem to work either.
fields.summary: executable files permission
Allow HTML Comments in Markdown (BB-9958)

fields.description:
Gents

Any chance you can implement a system to prevent an email being sent out every time a ticket is edited?

I just tried to explain something in a ticket that needed the text to be laid out in  a certain way. Because you don't have a link to the markdown/wiki syntax you use, and you don't have a preview function it took me 9 guesses/edits to get the linebreaks in the message to show up correctly..

..and my team mates got spammed 9 times by your email system, once for every time I edited the message.

How about only emitting an email once per timeframe (if last edit time < 3 minutes ago, don't emit) or percentage change (if the new message char count is max 1% different to the previous count, don't emit) - something like this would save the need for an intensive per-user-per-ticket debounce system
fields.summary: Debounce email notifications (BB-9917)

fields.description: I don't want get letters from my company team to my private email address, better use another/corporate email address.
fields.summary: Configurable email address for notifications per team

fields.description:
Hi,

I have encountered a strange bug in the "Recent Activity" feed for one of my repos.  Whenever a colleague makes a commit, it indicates that I made the commit in the "Recent ctivity" feed.  However, if I click on the details of the commit, it correctly shows my colleague as the author.\\
As well, doing a git log properly shows my colleague as the author.
fields.summary: Incorrect author associated to commits in "Recent Activity" feed

fields.description:
Currently, my team's workflow is the following:

* Create a new branch for every ticket.
* Make all changes for that ticket to the branch.
* Have someone else review the branch.
* If issues found, have the submitter add new changes.
* Else, use "git merge --squash" to merge the changes from the new branch back to the base branch.

We want to start using pull requests to help with code review but the current system does not recognize squashed merges and there is no way to manually mark a request as merged. This forces us to deny all pull requests in Bitbucket in order to close them.

Please update the pull request interface to either recognize squashed merges or allow the user to force the pull request into a "MERGED" status.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Can't Mark Pull Request As Merged When Using Squashed Merges (BB-9886)

fields.description:
I am having a similar issue as: [https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/8704/cannot-transfert-a-repos-to-private|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/8704/cannot-transfert-a-repos-to-private]

I cannot create a new private repo as I get the below error message. I do not have any additional users attached to this repo. I have however managed to create a public repo.

*Error*\\
"Your account needs needs space for 7 users to complete this action, but you are currently on the 5 user plan."
fields.summary: Cannot create repo as private

fields.description:
I had a private repository called chelor_88/medusa, another called chelor_88/leaducate\\
Suddenly I've got to a 404 page, and only 1 active repository.

Whay happened? Have I lost all of my information?
fields.summary: Some private repositories had been deleted

fields.description:
I find it very hard to quote long messages and, especially, chat logs because Markdown forces you to enter a ">" at the start of every paragraph. That makes quoting a skype chat, for example, a nightmare, so I usually end up formatting it like a code using "```", but that look way to ugly and doesn't wrap around.

My suggestion is to add a quote button to formatting options above the textarea that will automatically prepend ">" at the start of every selected paragraph.
fields.summary: Add "blockquote" formatting button (BB-9884)

fields.description: My team is managed by dev@mindgames.ru email. In attempt to add a member with dima@parametrika.ru email (which is mine too), I get invitation email but it cannot be accepted with "You are already a member of this group."
fields.summary: I can't change team's administrator

fields.description:
It would be great to have a commit status api like github: https://github.com/blog/1227-commit-status-api

This way my build status can be shown for every pull request before i merge.
fields.summary: As a bitbucket user i would like to have a commit status api like github
